question_text: Which of the following Narrow AI systems would you want to include when building the Broad AI system for a self-driving car?
correct_answer: Information from the global positioning system (GPS)

question_text: Complete the sentence. ___________ performs tasks without human intervention and completes mundane and repetitive tasks for humans, while ___________ allows humans to make final decisions after analysing data, reports, and other types of data.
Complete the sentence. Artificial intelligence (AI) refers to the ability of a machine to ________________ and ________________.
What one word best describes what AI can do?
Fill in the blank. __________ systems are used to predict global weather, trace pandemics, and help businesses predict future trends?
Which of the following is most likely to be unstructured data?
incorrect_answer2: The breeds of entrants in a dog show
incorrect_answer3: Prescriptions for patients in a large hospital

question_text: In which era did machines help humans sort data into structures to reveal its secrets, that is, to reveal more insight than just simply counting to get a sum total?
In which era did the advancements in fields ranging from cancer research to energy production show how its achievements impact people every day, and that it has exponentially increasing abilities?
Which of the following is the correct order of the three eras of computing?
In which era did computers guide astronauts from Earth to the moon and advance to handle more than one kind of instruction?

Shelby writes a survey that includes the following question: “Do you like chocolate (circle Yes or No), and why?” 
Which of the following describes the data Shelby will collect?
incorrect_answer3: Neither structure data nor unstructured data

question_text: Approximately how much of the world's data today is unstructured?
Fill in the blank. Data that is not completely raw and contains elements such as tags and organizational metadata is known as _______________ .
If names and email addresses are organised using a spreadsheet software, like Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel, which of type of data is this?
Fill in the blank. Machine learning can analyse ______________ data more quickly than a programmable computer can.

Tomas is programming an app to help people find their way in his city. He programs every possible route from the university auditorium to the museum. 

Which of the following is Thomas likely using?
Why does machine learning find answers in unstructured data more quickly than a programmable computer?
correct_answer: Machine learning can search every combination of factors very quickly
incorrect_answer1: Machine learning analyses every data combination
incorrect_answer2: Machine learning uses the most sophisticated program code
incorrect_answer3: Machine learning assembles all the data into a table before calculating

question_text: Complete the sentence. Machine learning is a type of AI with many advantages over programmable computers, including the distinguishing capability to _______________ and _______________.
Which of the following is an example of a probabilistic calculation?
incorrect_answer1: A strong feeling that you are most likely correct

question_text: Fill in the blank. _____ learning occurs when the algorithm is given unlabelled data.
YouTube and Netflix often recommend options to users. What kind of learning is used to generate these recommendations?
You train google photos to identify people in photographs. As a result, Google photos can recognise their faces.
Which method of learning does an AI system use when it uses the process of trial and error?
Fill in the blank. All supervised learning algorithms need _________ data.
What do AI researchers call the type of systems likely to emerge by 2050 and beyond?
Tesla cars are all connected and share what they learn when autonomously driving. This is an example of which of the following levels of AI?
What type of AI do services, such as Netflix, use to recommend offerings to users?
Which of the following represents the idea that AI will more into all industries, from finance, to education, to healthcare increasing productivity and enabling new opportunities?
With the use of billions of sensors, what is the new idea that will help to improve the Earth’s safety, sustainability, and security?
Which of the following is a key attribute of an artificial intelligence system?
Which of the following is the level of AI that is more versatile, can handle a wider range of related tasks, and is focused on integrating AI within specific business processes?

You are working on an AI system to help doctors treat patients. While describing your system to a group of doctors, you are asked the following question, "How does machine learning enable decision-making in complex scenarios, such as medical treatment choices?". Which of the following is the best response?
correct_answer: By providing probabilistic statements with confidence levels for different treatment options
incorrect_answer1: By ignoring potential outcomes and personal experience in decision making
incorrect_answer2: By offering determinstic solutions based on fixed criteria
incorrect_answer3: By relying soley on AI systems to make treatment decisions without human input

question_text: Which of the following methods of learning describes how an AI system learns using trial and error?
Which of the following types of data is categorised as qualative data, and cannot be processed and anaylsed by conventional data tools and methods?
You're working for an employer who wants to learn from social media what customers say about her products and services. Which of the following is the best reason to support moving to an AI system?
correct_answer: Social media data contains a mix of structured and un-structured data
incorrect_answer1: Social media data is completely unstructured
incorrect_answer3: Social media data is completely structured

question_text: Which of the following describes how machine learning differs from classical systems in structuring unstructured data?
correct_answer: Machine learning offers probabilitic statements instead of binary decisions
incorrect_answer1: Machine learning relies on deterministic algorithms to process unstructured data
incorrect_answer2: Machine learning relies on human judgement to structure unstructured data
incorrect_answer3: Machine learning constructs a predetermined structure of routes based on a database

question_text: In which of the following eras of computing did an IBM system beat a chess champion, a robot drive itself down a 131-mile desert trail, and IBM Watson beat two Jeopardy! grand champions?
Which of the following is a likely consequence of AI becoming more pervasive across industries?
correct_answer: Enhanced productivity and the creation of new opportunitues
incorrect_answer2: Reliance on current machine interface technologies will strengthened
incorrect_answer3: Humans and machine interactions will become increasingly standardised

question_text: Which of the following is an example of structured data?
Which of the following explains why an AI trained with machine learning can rapidly map the best route between two points on a map?
correct_answer: It performs millions of tiny calculations quickly, trying different routes through trial and error
incorrect_answer1: It predicts traffic problems based on stored alternative routes for every possible situation
incorrect_answer2: It uses predefined programming instructions to navigate through traffic
incorrect_answer3: It relies on a complete database of all possible routes through the city

question_text: Which of the following types of data can be analysed more quickly by machine learning than by a programmable computer?
Which of the following statements most accurately describes semi-structured data?
correct_answer: Data that combines features of both structured and unstructured data, using metadata for organisation
incorrect_answer1: Data that lacks any built-in organisation or structure, such as images and texts
incorrect_answer2: Quantative data processed and analysed by conventional data tools
incorrect_answer3: Information that can be organised in rows and columns, like in spreadsheet

question_text: Which level of AI refers to machines that can perform any intellectual task that a human can?
Which of the following acts on behalf of people in the physical world in a way that complements human abilities?
